topic.title: Why can't a malicious peer collect the IP addresses seeding a particluar Zite?
topic.body:
I have almost no understanding how ZerNet works, but just by collecting the messages given by ZeroNet.sh I could collect a lot of IP addresses related to ZeroNet. 
I guess the ones listed in lines containing string "Site:1TaLkF..jipT" are IP addresses of people seeding ZeroTalk. 

Why this is not a serious privacy issue?

1545519505_13CFz29UuNbUx54HmLqQBfxPQNN2F.body:
> [60](#comment_74_1Ekf2tGQLhG3iifFsuUk9RcBPx26cQmCD1): because others can easily alter what you've posted with a public id

Yes, but this way one has plausible anonymity on ZeroNet since anyone can use (or abuse) it. 
Or, one has to generate a throwaway ID for every (few) post(s) one makes.

Master seed for this ID:

`7d555a6adbfce31f35719621865cad6785bae29a7c53953073a746a4e8350172`
